record.title: UNANIMOUS-CONSENT REQUEST--S. 2185

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of S. 2185, a bill to permanently extend the current marginal tax rates, and that the bill be read a third time and passed. I further ask that the bill then be held at the desk until the House companion bill arrives and that all after the enacting clause be stricken, the text of the Senate-passed bill be inserted, and the House bill, as amended, be read for a third time and passed.
This is the same legislation extension that I just described.
Mr. President, again reserving the right to object, would the Senator again amend his consent request to instead allow the consent request I requested just previously?

record.chair: Will the Senator from Oklahoma so modify his request?

speaking.paragraph: No, I will not at this time.
Hearing his response, Mr. President, I must object.
